column1: metalgeartachyon 160763605443 "2017-05-17 10:34:19 GMT" https://metalgeartachyon.tumblr.com/post/160763605443/fuckstudy-fuckstudy-studying-japanese "fuckstudy: fuckstudy:   Studying Japanese: Resources!Â  In lieu of a â€˜how to studyâ€™ Japanese post
column2: hereâ€™s a few online resources which have helped me with studying Japanese throughout the years.Â  The resources listed below;  Range from beginnerâ€™s level to advanced level Are appropriate for studying for the JLPT (N4- N1) Â  Are appropriate for self study  Most are free
column3: or come with a free trial period! (excluding textbooks. but trust me
column4: iâ€™ve got your back) Essential Websites and Extensions IN RIKAIKUN WE TRUST Rikaikun:The one-stop shop for all your browsing needs. Hover over any kanji compound and this app will do all the translating for you. I found this incredibly useful for reading practice (esp. on news articles etc.). Jisho.org:Â One of the best dictionaries out there. Sorts most kanji according to JLPT level. Tofugu: A good general starting place to find resources and read interesting articles about Japanese culture
column5: ex-pats working in Japan and Studying in Japan. They also have a special series on applying for the JET Program!Â  Grammar  Particles? Verbs? Subjects? Conjugations?Â  JGram: All grammar is sorted by JLPT Levels. A good overview of common grammar structures.Â  Tanos: Also JLPT sorted Â  Introduction to Japanese Syntax
column6: Grammar and Language: a comprehensive overview for beginners NHK World: Lessons from the Japanese Public Broadcaster NHK. Largely Beginnerâ€™s Level. Dictionary of Japanese Grammar (beginners) (advanced) Handbook of Japanese Verbs: Beginners guide. Very handy pocket size so great for revision for the beginner-intermediate level. How to Tell the Difference between Japanese Particles: Comparisons and Exercises: something to help with those pesky particles!Â  Writing (Hiragana
column8: Kanji) Learn your alphabet(s) gdi!Â  Japanese Lesson @ryohkeiÂ is a Japanese calligrapher who handwrites beautiful characters + stroke order and definitions. Very informative
column9: given that handwritten kanji may differ from their typed counterparts.Â  @kanji-a-dayâ€‹ Practice Writing SheetsÂ Â  Charts (hiragana
column10: katakana) Networks Get you in touch with other native learners! Lang-8Â  Hi NativeÂ  RhinoSpikeÂ  ForvoÂ  Renshuu.orgÂ  Textbooks Genki:Â perfect for beginners Sou Matome:Â easy daily lessons and weekly review. All levels (sorted by JPLT level) Â Â  Kanzen MasterÂ  Tobira:Â highly recommended for those who are in the awkward intermediate - advanced plateau! Traditional Textbook format.Â  Tanki MasterÂ  500 Essential Japanese Expressions: A Guide to Correct Usage of Key Sentence Patterns: really useful for revision and to bridge the intermediate-advanced gap.Â  This blogspot: Lifesaver. Just
column11: trust me on this. Please.Â  Multimedia (Youtube
column13: learning a language is more than memorising charts and structures!Â  Bilingual Chika!Â One of my favourites. She recently published her own textbook! Â Japanese Podcast 101 Watch Japanese TV at Jpopsuki More? A masterlist of free resources by @nihongogogo This resource post by @study-ings A list of N2 resources by @learningkakumei This beginnerâ€™s resource post by @solarstudyâ€‹â€‹ Stay tuned for later parts to this series incl. going on exchange

metalgeartachyon 160763539998 "2017-05-17 10:30:20 GMT" https://metalgeartachyon.tumblr.com/post/160763539998/my-school-created-a-god "synfulwitchcraft: metalheadequestrian:  artistic-ape:  beyoursledgehammer:  kaible:  popculturepagan:  I am a student at an art university. There is an infamous building on our campus
column2: calledÂ â€œMontgomery Houseâ€ or more commonly
column3: Â â€œMonty.â€ Monty is the building for animation
column7: and basically everything that requires highly powerful
column8: highly specialized computers and software. The building is infamous for a couple of reasons. Itâ€™s located pretty far away from any other building
column9: for one.   The building itself used to be a coffin factory
column10: no joke. Â Another is the building has no windows. None. There are also no clocks anywhere. Once you enter Monty
column11: you are completely separated from the flow of time and the light of day. Â Probably the reason Monty is most known though is because students in theÂ â€œmonty majorsâ€ have to spend a lot of time there. A lot. It is not uncommon for somebody to spend more than a few days exclusively within the sunless
column12: dark walls of Monty. If you go to the building
column13: it is not surprising to see students sleeping on the floor
column15: on the computers. Some bring sleeping bags and rations. Some just forgo sleep
column16: buy espresso shots and work. The entire building just smells of coffee and sweat. It really seems like an exageration
column17: but its not hyperbole.Â  Why I bring this up is because of something thatâ€™s started recenetly. Inside the building
column18: the school has hung up artwork on the walls from other majors as is typical on campus. One of the artworks was a self-portrait painting of a man with long
column19: scraggly brown hair and a full beard looking pensively off into the distance. The painting became known asÂ â€œMonty Jesus.â€ Students
column20: in their desperation for their files to render
column22: began to offer prayers to Monty Jesus. Soon
column23: they began writing their prayers and taping them next to the painting. The wall is now covered
column25: in prayers to Monty Jesus for things likeÂ â€œFix the wifiâ€ andÂ â€œlet me live through finalsâ€ and more simplyÂ â€œhelp me.â€ Candles have been added. Literal candles are placed around Monty Jesus in hopes he will help them. This is how religions are born. Monty Jesus is considered aÂ â€œjokeâ€
column26: but people at Monty still holdâ€¦. quite a lot of superstitious faith in the concept. There is even talk of aÂ â€œMonty Satanâ€ that creates software failures. It might be in jest
column27: but these students really are hoping for some force to help them. And theyâ€™ve given it a name
column29: and respect. Â Monty Jesus is real
column30: and Iâ€™m sure of it. The desperate students have created their own spirit and their own form of worship
column33: didnâ€™t stop being relevant. It didnâ€™t stop being something people need and want
column34: and have the desire to create. Itâ€™s still happening
column35: and it always will as long as their are people. Â The spirit of creation
column37: is alive and well today and should not be ignored simply because it isÂ â€œnewâ€ orÂ â€œa joke.â€   Monty Jesus is Real and Strong and Our Friend  SCAD is such a weird and magical place.  As soon as I sawÂ â€œMontyâ€ I knew this was about my school  I go to this school and I can confirm he is real. Another weird happening that occurred in the dorm adjacent to Monty is the smashed fly incident. Basically
column38: someone smashed a fly on the stairway wall in the dorm and
column39: because no janitor in this building ever bothers to thoroughly clean the place
column40: the fly stayed there for a good few weeks. Eventually
column41: one of the students wroteÂ â€œARTâ€ next to the fly with a sharpie
column42: and a few days after that
column43: someone made a tiny frame and name tag to accompany the art piece Eventually some fool took this beautiful art piece down
column44: and someone wrote a goddamn article about it in our school newspaper which prompted several students to erect a mini shrine on the stairwell in honor of the smashed fly. Art school is truly a magical place.  This is fantastic. " False text
